summary: Email chain discussing coordination of victim assistance services for a potential Epstein victim in South Africa. The correspondence involves FBI personnel and others arranging for potential payment of therapy sessions through the Victim Services Division (VSD).

persons.name: Dent, S.
persons.context: FBI employee (PT) who sent an email on January 10, 2020, regarding an Epstein victim in South Africa, asking what is needed to coordinate services.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking
persons.context: Agent from the FBI's New York Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking unit who has been in contact with the victim's US-based lawyer and is coordinating to connect the victim with services.

connections.person2: Special Agent FBI New York Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking
connections.description: Both are involved in FBI coordination regarding victim assistance for a potential Epstein victim.

events.title: Victim Meeting Referenced
events.description: A victim meeting was held where victims and their attorneys were informed that the FBI Victim Services Division (VSD) would pay for up to six therapy sessions if they were not eligible for crime victims compensation.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division (VSD) offered to pay for up to six therapy sessions for Epstein victims not eligible for crime victims compensation.
A potential Epstein victim in South Africa was seeking trauma-focused therapy and was in contact with a US-based lawyer.
FBI personnel were coordinating to facilitate victim assistance services, including potential payment for psychiatric care.
The victim had been unable to attend a prior victim meeting but was requesting referrals for therapists.
